docs.snippet: Invoking an act of God to explain a human-made tragedy has become the go-to excuse in public life....
docs.lead_paragraph: Invoking an act of God to explain a human-made tragedy has become the go-to excuse in public life.
docs.abstract: Charles Homans First Words column examines power of phrase 'perfect storm' to categorize particularly destructive incidents as being outside human control, relieving individuals involved of full accountability; says phrase has been used as form of absolution in public debacles like Cleveland's fatal police shooting of Tamir Rice shooting, and Enron's  bankruptcy.

headline.main: How the ‘Perfect Storm’ Became the Perfect Cop-Out
